title: Meet a big problem，i'm going out of my mind
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon version 2022.99.99-dev-d223580d

OS & Version: OSX

I was syncing from the 0 block and current stage is about 
[04-13|00:01:21.948] [6/16 Execution] Executed blocks         number=9815818

But accident happened suddenly, someone touched my ssd , and system shows  my ssd was ejected.
I remount my ssd, and restart with the cmd:
erigon --datadir /Volumes/U/backup/erigon/ --prune=hc --prune.h.older=0 --prune.c.older=0 --batchSize=2048
I hope it will recover the process and stage,but error happended, here is the key log:

INFO[04-13|23:22:49.435] Flushed buffer file                      name=/Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-3933384531 alloc="2.1 GiB" sys="7.7 GiB"
INFO[04-13|23:22:54.108] [8/16 HashState] etl: temp files removed total size="21.7 GiB"
INFO[04-13|23:22:54.149] [8/16 HashState] etl: temp files removed total size="3.3 GiB"
EROR[04-13|23:22:54.149] Staged Sync                              err="[8/16 HashState] failed MdbxKV cursor.Next(): mdbx_cursor_get: MDBX_PAGE_NOTFOUND: Requested page not found"
INFO[04-13|23:22:55.047] [8/16 HashState] Promoting plain state   from=0 to=9813575
INFO[04-13|23:23:09.095] Flushed buffer file                      name=/Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-1871677176 alloc="1.7 GiB" sys="7.7 GiB"
INFO[04-13|23:23:23.739] Flushed buffer file                      name=/Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-2086194098 alloc="1.4 GiB" sys="7.7 GiB"
INFO[04-13|23:23:25.048] [8/16 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    current key=02fd92d1bff7... alloc="1.4 GiB" sys="7.7 GiB"

I monitor log for a while , it keep looping
 
INFO[04-13|23:52:07.509] [8/16 HashState] etl: temp files removed total size="3.3 GiB"
EROR[04-13|23:52:07.509] Staged Sync                              err="[8/16 HashState] failed MdbxKV cursor.Next(): mdbx_cursor_get: MDBX_PAGE_NOTFOUND: Requested page not found"
INFO[04-13|23:52:08.458] [8/16 HashState] Promoting plain state   from=0 to=9813575
INFO[04-13|23:52:23.066] Flushed buffer file                      name=/Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-722922546 alloc="1.4 GiB" sys="7.7 GiB"
INFO[04-13|23:52:37.620] Flushed buffer file                      name=/Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-214514274 alloc="1.4 GiB" sys="7.7 GiB"
the dir file size always loop from 0 to 25GB 
0B	    /Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/
 25G	/Volumes/U/backup/erigon/etl-temp/

maybe the db file have some problem , I'm a little bit broken ,are there any rescue measures? 
please help..

> mdbx_cursor_get: MDBX_PAGE_NOTFOUND: Requested page not found"

Please use [memtest86](https://www.memtest86.com/) to check your RAM and then check SSD/HDD.

 ! corrupted broken-page #0, mod-txnid 0
 ! mismatch actual pgno (0) != expected (167984517)
 ! mdbx_cursor_get() failed, error -30797 MDBX_PAGE_NOTFOUND: Requested page not found
 - problems: different number of entries (1)
 - summary: 0 records, 0 dups, 0 key's bytes, 0 data's bytes, 1 problems
 ! mdbx_cursor_get() failed, error -30782 MDBX_BAD_TXN: Transaction is not valid for requested operation, e.g. had errored and be must aborted, has a child, or is invalid

Total 6 errors are detected, elapsed 578.639 seconds.

> * ! corrupted broken-page #0, mod-txnid 0
>   ! mismatch actual pgno (0) != expected (167984517)

Your DB is corrupted.
The DB page `#167984517` seems is zeroed.
This cannot be fixed since (at least) this corruptions has occurred `4639682 - 4639667 = 15` transactions ago.

With a fairly high degree of confidence, I can assume that this is the result of a hardware failure, and not any software bug.
So you should check your hardware, especially RAM and disks.

> 
Thank you [erthink](https://github.com/erthink)
It  means I have to sync from the beginning.Am i right?
1. Check hardware 2. If it’s broken - change hardware 3. Then sync from beginning

> 1. Check hardware 2. If it’s broken - change hardware 3. Then sync from beginning

I see , I have to resync , thank you [AskAlexSharov](https://github.com/AskAlexSharov) ,my  heart broken,thank you again [erthink](https://github.com/erthink)
